column2: Are you kidding me?! Joey. Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey!\nJoey! Joey!!'
(joining in, in his sleep) Joey. Joey. Joey. Joey! Joey!!'
Oh. Oh, did-did-did I wake you?'
Gunther, can I get another cup of coffee, please? (Gunther starts to\npour him another cup.) So uh, what do you do when you\xc2\x92re not working here?'
You don\xc2\x92t need to fill these silences.'
Oh, okay, thanks. (He goes back to the couch and rejoins Monica, Joey,\nand Phoebe.)'
Chandler, that\xc2\x92s like your fourth cup of coffee!'
Well, I am drinking lots of cups of coffee because I\xc2\x92m exhausted!\nBecause Joey started snoring!'
He\xc2\x92s in a different room! He\xc2\x92s really that loud?'
(proudly) Oh, you should here me.'
It\xc2\x92s not something to be proud of, okay? You have to go to a\nsleep clinic!'
Look, I told ya, I\xc2\x92m not going to any clinic! I don\xc2\x92t have a\nproblem, you\xc2\x92re the one with the problem! You should go to a "Quit being a baby\nand leave me alone" clinic!'
They don\xc2\x92t have those.'
Yeah, they do! Quit being a baby and leave me alone! There, you\xc2\x92ve\njust had your first class!'
Y\xc2\x92know I used to go out with this guy that was a really light\nsleeper, and whenever I started to snore, he would just roll me over\xc2\x85'
Ohhh, yeah!'
He would just roll me over and I would stop snoring.'
Next time you snore, I\xc2\x92m rolling ya over!'
I gotta do what I gotta do, you gotta do what you gotta do, you just do\nit.'
(entering) Hey guys!'
Hey, all right!'
Hey!'
Oh, the Olympics.'
Have you guys picked a date yet?'
Oh no, not yet.'
I still cannot believe you\xc2\x92re engaged! (Ross looks at her)\nJust \xc2\x91cause its happening so fast; not \xc2\x91cause you\xc2\x92re such a loser. '
Oh. Thanks. Uh, has anyone seen Rach?'

Ugh, she\xc2\x92s upstairs not doing the dishes! And I tell ya\nsomething! I\xc2\x92m not doing them this time! I don\xc2\x92t care if those dishes sit in the\nsink until they\xc2\x92re all covered with\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92ll do them when I get home!'
Yeah\xc2\x97oh! Hey listen umm, Emily found this wedding dress in\nLondon\xc2\x85'
Already?!'
Yeah, but it didn\xc2\x92t fit. Well, luckily there\xc2\x92s a store here that\nhas one left in her size, but I\xc2\x92m the groom, I\xc2\x92m not supposed to see the\ndress\xc2\x85 '
I\xc2\x92ll pick it up for you!'
Thank you.'
Okay.'
Oh, she\xc2\x92s got you running errands, y\xc2\x92know, picking up\nwedding dresses\xc2\x85 (Laughs and makes like Indiana Jones and his whip) Wah-pah!'
What\xc2\x92s wah-pah?'
Y\xc2\x92know, whipped! Wah-pah!'
That\xc2\x92s not whipped! Whipped is wh-tcssh!'
That\xc2\x92s what I did. Wah-pah!'
You can\xc2\x92t do anything!'
Hey, Mon, I was just doing the dishes! '
Hey!'
Oh! It\xc2\x92s you. (She stops doing the dishes.) Hi.'
Hey, do uh, do you have a minute?'
Yeah, yeah, I was just about to take a break anyways, so\xc2\x85'
So listen uh, I know you and I haven\xc2\x92t really had a chance to talk\nsince uh, Emily and I decided to get married, and uh, I was just wondering how you were.'
Oh.'
I know if you were getting married I\xc2\x92d feel, kinda\xc2\x85..\ny\xc2\x92know.'
Yeah. Yeah. Definitely, well it definitely took me by surprise, but\nI\xc2\x92m okay.'
Yeah?'
Yeah.'
All right, I just wanted to check.'
Oh, that\xc2\x92s sweet.'
You\xc2\x92re great. And I-I know someday this will happen for you too. You\njust hang in there.'
(breaking the hug) Uhh, hang in there?'
Oh, no, I didn\xc2\x92t mean, uh\xc2\x85'
I mean maybe you didn\xc2\x92t hear about a serious relationship called me\nand Joshua?'
Oh, I thought you guys had just been on like four dates, I didn\xc2\x92t\nrealise that had become anything, yet.'
Oh, no-no-no, no-no-no, it has become, it has\xc2\x97yeah. Oh no, those\nwere four great dates. '
Oh. Yeah?'
Yeah. Oh, yeah. And I mean, the connection, I mean y\xc2\x92know,\nemotionally, mentally, physically\xc2\x85'
Wow, that\xc2\x92s-that\xc2\x92s-that\xc2\x92s incredible.'
I know isn\xc2\x92t it? It\xc2\x92s like I\xc2\x92m right there with Joshua.'
Uh-huh.'
You are right there with Emily. And it\xc2\x92s y\xc2\x92know, it\xc2\x92s\nkinda like\xc2\x85. it\xc2\x92s a tie! Well, I gotta get, I gotta get back to the dishes.'
I gotta get to work.'
Oh yeah? Fine.'
Hey, y\xc2\x92know, y\xc2\x92know what would make me really happy?'
Oh yeah, no, what\xc2\x92s that?'
If like the four of us could all y\xc2\x92know, hang out together. Uh, in\nfact Emily\xc2\x92s coming into town this weekend, why don\xc2\x92t you say we all have\ndinner? Say, Sunday night?'
That would be great!'
Yeah, all right, it\xc2\x92s a date. (He leaves)'
(to the closed door) Hang in there. You hang in there. (Gives him the\nraspberry.) '
(coming back in) Did you say something?'
No, just singing. (Does a little song.)'
Oh my God! Ohh! Look at this one! It\xc2\x92s so beautiful!'
Yeah, but y\xc2\x92know, about have of these are gonna end up getting\ndivorced.'
May I help you ladies?'
Oh, yes, umm, I\xc2\x92m here to pick up a dress that you have on hold.'
Yes, what\xc2\x92s the name, please?'
Emily Waltham.'
Yes! I have it right here. (Phoebe and Monica both gasp at the\ndress.) Would you like to try it on Ms. Waltham?'
(laughs) Okay.'
You\xc2\x92re the most beautiful bride I\xc2\x92ve ever seen.'
I am, aren\xc2\x92t I?'
Ms. Waltham?'
Yes?'
We\xc2\x92re closing.'
All right. (Goes to take off the dress.)'
And could I get my ring back?'

All right buddy, time to roll over. (Rolls him over, and discovers a\nsurprise) (Looking down) No-no! (Covers his eyes) No, no-n-n-n-no!! You are going to a\nclinic! You\xc2\x92re going to a clinic, and a pyjama store!'
Does she use the cups? Yes! I believe she does. Does she use the plates?\nYes! I believe she does. (Looks at the wedding dress and stops.)'
Oh. Thank you. Ohhh, thank you very much. Oh, thank you for coming.\n(There\xc2\x92s a knock on the door.) Uh, just a second!'
No-no, let me in!'
Phoebe?'
Yeah!'
Can you just hold on for one minute?'
No, you have to let me in right now!!'
Are you alone?'
Yes!'
All right.'
This sucks! I didn\xc2\x92t know I had to stay up all night before I went to\nthis stupid sleep clinic! I\xc2\x92m so tired!'
It\xc2\x92s 6
Yeah, well\xc2\x85'
(entering) Hi!'
Hey, I hear that you and Joshua are going out to dinner with Ross and\nEmily, and I think that\xc2\x92s, I think that\xc2\x92s really cool.'
Yeah, Rach, I think you\xc2\x92re handling that really well.'

Handling it? What do you mean, handling it? There\xc2\x92s nothing to\nhandle. Now, maybe I would have a problem with this if it wasn\xc2\x92t for me and Joshua.\nY\xc2\x92know, they\xc2\x92re not gonna get married anyway!'
What?'

Come on! They rushed into this thing so fast it\xc2\x92s ridiculous! I
mean, they\xc2\x92re gonna be engaged for like what? A year? And somewhere along the way,
one of them is gonna realise what they\xc2\x92ve done and they\xc2\x92re call the whole thing
off. I\xc2\x92m telling ya, you\xc2\x92re gonna be dancing at my wedding before you\xc2\x92re
dancing at there\xc2\x92s.'
Yeah, well, I don\xc2\x92t dance at weddings.'
Why not?'
Because weddings are a great place to meet women, and when I dance, I\nlook like this\xc2\x85 (Starts to dancing really, really, really badly. Ross enters behind\nhim and he stops.)'
Hey man.'
Hey!'
So, what are you guys doing four weeks from today?'
Nothing.'
Nothing.'
I am\xc2\x85 (Looks in his date book.) free!'
Great! Because Emily and I are getting married in a month!'
Yep!'
In a month?'
Yeah!'
You mean, you mean 30 days?'
Yeah.'
From now? '
Yeah.'
Well, that\xc2\x92s great.'

Yeah! Yeah, Emily always wanted to get married in this beautiful place
that her parents got married, but it\xc2\x92s going to be torn down, so\xc2\x85 I mean, I-I
know it\xc2\x92s crazy, but everything up \xc2\x91til now has been so crazy, and I don\xc2\x92t
know, this just feels right. Y\xc2\x92know?'
(still looking in date book) Hey! That\xc2\x92s the day after I stop\nmenstruating! (They all look at him.) This isn\xc2\x92t mine.'
(entering) Hey, Rachel.'
Hi!'
What\xc2\x92s up? You\xc2\x92re voice sounded all squeaky on the phone.'
Ohh, nothing, I just wanted to see you. See you and hug you. (Hugs him)\nSee you.'
Great!'
Yeah! (She sits down) Sit!'
(sitting) You okay?'
I\xc2\x92m more than okay, I am really, really happy! Wanna know why?'
Do I?'
\xc2\x91Cause I am really happy about us. I think we are, I think we are\nso on the right track! Y\xc2\x92know? I mean, I think we are working, I think we are\nclicking. Y\xc2\x92know?'
Yeah, sure-sure, yeah,\nwe\xc2\x92re-we\xc2\x92re-we\xc2\x92re-we\xc2\x92re-we\xc2\x92re clicking.'
Yeah-yeah, y\xc2\x92know if-if there was just like one little area where\nI\xc2\x97that I think we need\xc2\x97we would need to work on; I-I would think it was\nwe\xc2\x92re just not crazy enough!'
I-I gotta say, I-I-I-I\xc2\x92m not too sure I agree with that.'

Well, yeah, right, y\xc2\x92know what? Yeah, you\xc2\x92re right, I mean, we
no, we have our fun. Yeah! But if (Grunts uncomprehensively)\xc2\x85\xc2\x85I mean, I mean
like craaaazy! Y\xc2\x92know? Okay, all right. This is gonna, this is gonna sound
y\xc2\x92know, a little umm, hasty, but uh, just go with it. Umm. Ugh. What if we got
married?'
What?! (Gunther is listening in.)'

Oh, I know, I know, it\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s so, it\xc2\x92s so totally like,\n"Whoa! Can we do this?" Y\xc2\x92know, I mean, but I mean it just feels right!\nDon\xc2\x92t you think? It does! I mean, it just feels right, don\xc2\x92t you think?'
Wow! Uhh, Rachel uhh, you\xc2\x92re a real special lady, but my divorce\nisn\xc2\x92t final yet and, and, and we\xc2\x92ve been on four days, so I\xc2\x92m thinking\n"No, but thanks."'
YOU IDIOT!!!!!'
Your name, please?'
Joey Tribbiani.'
Um-hmm, and did you stay up all night in preparation for\nyour sleep study. (Joey doesn\xc2\x92t answer) Uh, sir? (Joey starts snoring)'
(answering for him) Yes he did.'
Alll right, we\xc2\x92ll call you in a few minutes.'
(waking Joey) Hey, check out that girl! She is really hot!'
(sleepily) Yeah, she is. Wow! (Falls back asleep, loudly) How you\ndoin\xc2\x92?'
What?!'
You\xc2\x92re coming on to the entire room! (He goes over to pick up a\nstack of magazines next to her, and to get her attention, he throws them back down.)\nI\xc2\x92m Chandler.'
I\xc2\x92m Marjorie.'
Hi.'
Hi.'
You mind if I\xc2\x85'
No, please. '
So uh, what are you in for?'
I talk in my sleep.'
What a coincidence, I listen in my sleep.'
(asleep) So why don\xc2\x92t you give me your number?'
Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe, still defying reality, are now throwing\na bouquet at each other, pretending to catch the actual bouquet at an actual\nwedding.]"
Okay, ready?'
Yeah.'
Okay.'
(catching it) I got it! Mine! (They both hug)'
Congratulations!'
Thank you!'
Okay! My turn! My turn!'
Okay! (Gets into position) Okay, ready?'
(cocking her head from side to side in some pre-bouquet-catching ritual)\nYeah.'
Okay. (Phoebe turns and throws it on the couch.)'
(upset) That was a terrible throw!!'
I\xc2\x92m not gonna right to you! That\xc2\x92s not real!'
Look at me! My big concern is what\xc2\x92s real?! (Finally realises) Oh\nmy God. We\xc2\x92re really sad, aren\xc2\x92t we?'
Yeah, I think we are.'
This isn\xc2\x92t even my dress.'
Well, at least you didn\xc2\x92t rent yours from a store called,\n"It\xc2\x92s Not Too Late."'
I\xc2\x92m changing out of this.'
Me too.'
In like a half-hour?'
Me too.'
Okay, throw it straight this time.'
Okay.'
I\xc2\x92m getting married next!!'
Yay!'
I hate my regular clothes now! Y\xc2\x92know? I look down and-and I\nknow that this isn\xc2\x92t gonna be the most special day of my life.'
Yeah. I mean it was kinda fun for a while, but didn\xc2\x92t you start\nfeeling silly?'
I guess.'
Oh my God! '
Oh God.'
Oh, you\xc2\x92re such a cheater!'
(entering) Hello! Little ones.'
Hey!'
Hey!'
So, is Joey gonna stop snoring?'
Yep! And! A beautiful woman agreed to go out with me. (They\xc2\x92re\nstunned.) Joey wanted to ask her out, but uh, she picked me.'
Oh, how\xc2\x92d that happen?'
Because I\xc2\x92m cooler.'
No, seriously.'
Well she\xc2\x92s, she\xc2\x92s the kinda girl\xc2\x97Joey was unconscious. '
(muffled by the mouth guard) Hey you guys! What\xc2\x92s happening?'
Oh my God!'
What is that?'
(muffled) Oh, they gave it to me at the sleep clinic, and it\xc2\x92s gonna\nhelp me not to snore.'
Well, are you asleep right now, Joe? \xc2\x91Cause I don\xc2\x92t think you\nhave to wear it unless you are!'
(takes out the mouth guard) I know I don\xc2\x92t have too! It tastes good.\n(Puts it back in.)'
Plus, you look cool.'
(entering from her bedroom) Well, I just called Joshua\xc2\x85'
Oh, how did it go?'
Well, I did my best to convince him that I\xc2\x92m not some crazy girl\nwho is dying to get married\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92m just going through a hard time.'
What did he say?'
Well uh, his answering machine was very understanding. Ugh. I\nfeel blue.'
Ohh, sweetie! (Goes to comfort her.) Hey, I bet you anything that\nhe\xc2\x92s gonna call you again.'

Yeah, maybe, but I don\xc2\x92t think I even care. I don\xc2\x92t think
he\xc2\x92s the one I\xc2\x92m sad about. Y\xc2\x92know, I know that I said that I am totally
okay with Ross getting married, but as it turns out, I don\xc2\x92t think I\xc2\x92m handling
it all that well.'
Yeah, maybe.'
And I-I am just trying to figure out why.'
Any luck?'
Well, yeah, y\xc2\x92know how Ross and I were on again, off again, on\nagain, off again? I guess I just figured that somewhere down the road, we would be on\nagain.'
Again. Y\xc2\x92know what? I think we all did.'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey! (She jumps up and throws Emily\xc2\x92s wedding dress into\nRachel\xc2\x92s room.)'
So, I got us some reservations for Sunday night, okay? How about,\nErnie\xc2\x92s at 9 o\xc2\x92clock?'
Yeah, well, you uh, better make it for three.'
Oh, see I-I don\xc2\x92t know if we\xc2\x92re gonna be hungry at three.'
Three people. Joshua\xc2\x92s not gonna be there.'
What happened?'
Uh, well, I think, I think he broke up with me.'
Noo. Why?'
Well, apparently he scares easy.'
Oh, Rachel, I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m sorry.'
It\xc2\x92s okay. Sometimes, things don\xc2\x92t work out the way you\xc2\x92d\nthought they would.'
Come here.'
(breaking the hug) Oh, hey, don\xc2\x92t you have to go pick up Emily?'
Yeah. '
Yeah.'
You okay?'
Yeah! I got my girls.'
Ugh. (She goes over and lays her head on Phoebe\xc2\x92s lap.)'
(looks at Monica) Hey, y\xc2\x92know what might cheer you up?'
What?'
Y\xc2\x92know, I gotta tell ya, this really does put in a better mood.'
Oh, I wish there was a job where I could wear this all the time. (Pause)\nMaybe someday, there will be.'
Oh God! He\xc2\x92s gonna come by and borrow some candles for his big\ndate!'
Oh, okay! (She goes to answer the door.)'
No-no, Rachel, don\xc2\x92t get it! He can\xc2\x92t see us!'
No, yeah! The groom cannot see the bride!'
I\xc2\x92m not gonna marry Chandler!'
Not after this!'
Okay, you guys, just relax. (She goes over to open the door, and as she\ndoes, she says.) I doooo. (Sees that it\xc2\x92s Joshua, not Chandler that knocked on the\ndoor.)'
I gotta go.'
Oh, wait, Joshua! Joshua! (Pause) (Comes back inside) Yeah, well, that\noughta do it.'
(muffled by the mouth guard) Dude! I am trying to sleep! (Shrugs to\nsay, "What\xc2\x92s up with that?")'
